9752546408044C17B9367FD16FB37617.description: Research, document and share information about various choirs, conductors, choral leaders and vocalists in Saskatchewan (e.g., Saskatchewan Choral Federation, Choral Canada).

4BFF61B21D1B4937AC44EFFE18715A1F.description: Examine and discuss interpretive decisions that reflect a particular musical style.

7291E11237954169912CC9F0011453B8.description: Determine the aesthetic qualities of the work.

8671790B6E86421EB816C00D982DCC30.description: Probe and challenge assumptions about the selection.

681142060DD64BA7ABC8569F8CEE6C4F.description: Contribute to dialogue and common understanding of the selection.

AEBAD9884DAE49D6A7F29D7D717802C6.description: Differentiate among various genres and styles of choral performances.

CF90022CAC17492AA256C0881BD4C1E2.description: Critique different arrangements of the same choral text.

08135344A0774CD8980B8428F781563B.description: Discuss components of a performance critique (e.g., analyze technique, assess interpretation, make informed opinions).

05644BD57C5442B68ADE5C2B347AF199.description: Seek out and select examples of choral performances to critique.

86AF53710F05498B9F2752463A8821E9.description: Critique a variety of live or recorded choral ensemble performances.

A073DBE6F91F49CBA4FBB53FE7208FBC.description: Reflect on, and document, rehearsals and performances to achieve artistic intent and support ensemble and individual musical growth.

472DD82784F04F408EB8F297645262CD.description: Examine performance spaces including acoustic properties (e.g., reverb, tone, volume) and make necessary adjustments (e.g., singing techniques, microphones).

E0471A9CC63049B0832B2571102BD74F.description: Co-develop criteria for evaluating the quality and effectiveness of music performances and compositions and apply the criteria to personal listening, composing and performing.

BD90F99C4AB94F57833400A262B40E31.description: Examine the process of polishing a piece including how to refine a rehearsal (formative) or a performance (summative).

560ABEE8A81A407C9583DD3C1DF8ACB8.description: Explore different choral structures or models for small ensembles (e.g., rotate the section leaders, conductorless singing).

A4C1679D137A449CB39414EDEEAF0C88.description: Identify opportunities for improvement through various approaches (e.g., small ensembles, soprano sectionals).

2ED718CBE0B54F59A722BE480C1188DF.description: Take ownership of the rehearsal process (e.g., What do we need to spend more time on later?).

FDBA7C12596845929DEB3640A0BC3DF1.description: Determine criteria collectively for critiquing own ensemble rehearsals and performances

51D4BDF641654A9B872ED45A1CB888F5.description: Discuss ways to conduct constructive critiques (e.g., identifying what is going well and how we can build on that; examine how we can pull from one area to make another better?)

EF3BE4F3FBB1483EB7CF4BD0FA2CC650.description: Assess and refine own process for improvement as individual singers and as an ensemble.

98951DA49FA0419FA03C348ECA315ABD.description: Critical/Responsive (CR) Goal: Students will respond to artistic expressions of Saskatchewan, Canadian and international artists using critical thinking, research, creativity and collaborative inquiry

494A39FC58C3487481BB6D5B0DA16F6E.description: Discuss text issues/references in choral music.

2AA4D2ED26F44349BC0BA90EFF9F3A19.description: Conduct an inquiry into questions related to censorship and community sensitivities.

DCC02D83E0364025B206AC54F05857A1.description: Discuss the selection of repertoire and issues of community norms (e.g., appropriateness for audience, singing secular or sacred repertoire, lyrics).

5FB23423C3C34E45A98ED315D64A344D.description: Analyse and discuss societal standards (e.g., legal, ethical, community norms and values) and cultural sensitivities related to choral music.

26F018B4AF414C36B9145A57F0E8BC38.description: Seek opportunities to hear (live and recorded) and participate in choral music performances.

D675FF47D95043AFA34961E054860A3C.description: Research supports for musicians such as unions, professional associations, agents, Elders and Knowledge Keepers, provincial and federal grants (e.g., funding for creation, touring and recording).

E8E8A8A99FFB4CB988F038F45FC53F04.description: Research and discuss the roles that choral music plays in Saskatchewan including First Nations and Métis traditions.

7C664E57439C4871819DEA8D98FFF01D.description: Make connections between choral music and other areas of study (e.g., literature, math, science, social sciences, physical education, other arts).

793DFB88522A4989805DB4FD0559F4E7.description: Research career avenues and investigate opportunities (e.g., scholarships, entrance requirements, music schools) for continuing study at the post-secondary level.

5950DD452CF446049311DEA7D8BA07EE.description: Conduct an inquiry into opportunities and benefits for continuing lifelong engagement in choral music (e.g., community choirs, musical theatre).

DA869E3EB55148DDAB5AB2B64DEBD491.description: Explore and research pathways and benefits of continuing engagement in choral music.

E9F179200B1146EEBD26A351A7270AAD.description: Create a plan for continuing engagement in choral music.

3BD40BFDED9045A09112A6ADC105D34B.description: Analyze how the work of contemporary Indigenous singers may be influenced by cultural traditions and global change (e.g., treaty education outcome SI12 - investigate the values and beliefs of self, family, community and society in relation to the importance of honouring the spirit and intent of treaties).

0E27026F421847A38D850C95216CD308.description: Describe how specific selections of contemporary Indigenous music, local and global, incorporates traditional and/or innovative singing styles.

939DC69F773749A28FB796DCBF6A2E9D.description: Research social and cultural influences (e.g., family life, legacy of residential schools, languages, personal experiences growing up, traditional stories, global issues) on contemporary Indigenous singers and their work.

3BF723AE67884DFCA09A67F0335F94EE.description: Engage with Indigenous singers to learn about contemporary music expressions.

B1A17E9C57B14954B5DBF7832D455507.description: Research (e.g., reference materials, personal interviews) contemporary Indigenous music and vocalists.

CFF1AFAD69854276BABD3060B704F4C4.description: Examine contemporary Indigenous vocal music and composers.

7A5A79964D7C47E289B1D476055CD805.description: Co-create a symbolic representation (e.g., visual, vocal, digital) of Saskatchewan choral music.

E3127BF0403145069A9210AFC4C73F28.description: Examine ways that choral music can include or exclude people (e.g., audition processes, lack of site reading ability, financial barriers, marginalized populations, access to education).

1C10FDE73B634D81A2E3DB6FD0BAF233.description: Conduct an inquiry into how aural traditions are maintained or changed in choral music.

D43252255CDF47F986A331575AF5A6C5.description: Discuss why the content (e.g., text, subject matter within a genre, theme, message) of choral music may change over time.

9F03AC6684DA41C1B811F8BD4DB1FBFB.description: Examine various purposes (e.g., sacred, celebratory, entertainment) of choral music and how those purposes may change.

2EA9455944014BB09AC4E9DFB5CBDA5D.description: Discuss how choral music has changed or developed through various eras.

FFD28A4AF87D43B29E330260658DBA24.description: Investigate how the choral music being studied has changed over time (e.g., role of choir, changing styles or genres).

CBFD148C39BA470F85F6E95BA865E043.description: Cultural/Historical (CH) Goal: Students will investigate the content and aesthetics of the arts within cultural, historical and contemporary contexts and understand the connection between the arts and the human experience.

E341CB75FCB1474AA588B3886C49070F.description: Engage (e.g., online, in person) with artists from diverse cultural backgrounds.

21FBD8233976435EA7A0427FE47B4437.description: Incorporate stylistic features reflective of the socio-cultural contexts of the choral repertoire being studied.

55AA1065082A411CA6772EC90C99E46B.description: Sing (e.g., warm up, excerpt, repertoire, short folk song) in a minimum of two languages.

90E8E3AD475F4047ABF7A751DC883ECC.description: Refine vocal characteristics and stylistic features that are typical in diverse music genres (e.g., spirituals, jazz, blues, opera).

27E679DA7CDE4CA0A9671CF69FE60986.description: Refine stylistic practices within various forms of vocal and choral music traditions.

C6040929A3784FA28A2897849356C41E.description: Reflect on individual and group compositions and arrangements, identifying strengths and challenges encountered.

7FF5175C359F4768A54AEA63397BFCF6.description: Compose, arrange or improvise a phrase or passage (e.g., develop a counter melody or descant).

DFDE451AB715413FB2CB73F67AC2DAEC.description: Explore and examine composition and arranging techniques (e.g., What is the composer doing musically in relation to the text? What is a compositional hook?).

F5409181AE174B5FB0CB88934E4307E3.description: Explore and examine composition and arranging techniques (e.g., What is the composer doing musically in relation to the text? What is a compositional hook?).

8E7665430F52457DB07DA9E3BD8D8AEA.description: Experiment with stylistically appropriate group improvisation (e.g., with chords/harmonic background).

71DB427268ED4FC1BB9B19930C27EED5.description: Embellish, ornament or improvise on a melody.

E140C50E8651462BA1941F695BDE5F37.description: Take creative risks when creating and refining work.

9744DB3CE937402F8F6929F4C5EA0587.description: Investigate ways that music elements (e.g., tempo, rhythm) can be used to express musical ideas.

03CC9F6DD712445C8D9573EB6799C9BB.description: Improvise, arrange and compose with purpose for meaning.

BCC2CA7C81004BA4861B1C587C3BA458.description: Interpret expressive terms and music symbols within the context of the repertoire (e.g., tempo, dynamics, form, style, articulation, graphic symbols).

FA1B046B8D614CE0923A0C0EF0D4420C.description: Demonstrate ability to learn and lead others in learning music through aural transmission (e.g., picking own part out of harmony, learning by listening to others, matching with others in same section, using another part as a reference for singing own part, learning a melody through repetition).

F129E02787944AD0A89B927C9B27D7A7.description: Sight sing a short passage (e.g., at a lower difficulty level than the repertoire studied).

EF5D4DE07D0F42FB805E81C7AE791EB4.description: Demonstrate increased ability to read, notate, understand and interpret written musical scores and various notation systems.

982C8688B5DB4C3CAB42317337FCC191.description: Demonstrate, with increased accuracy, the ability to respond to notation systems such as letter names, solfege, scale degrees, aural cues when singing in the context of the repertoire studied.

0D387091B18F455C8B99907E439FCCEC.description: Demonstrate ability to interpret, with increased accuracy and expression, music using various visual (e.g., standard and/or non-standard notation, written musical scores, graphic score) and aural music systems.

22D9079948314AE080995A9C1A0F3594.description: Demonstrate ability to respond to the conductor.

29CD770EBD5545AAAF856BCE071D3099.description: Incorporate movement in ensemble work (e.g., use movement to experience music concepts) recognizing how singing involves the whole body.

2338EEDC940241DAA2340272111023CC.description: Identify musical functions of own and others’ parts in a song (e.g., melody, harmony, bass line).

FCCE33FCE6A6486C8C9F65E3CB833C75.description: Determine and apply processes (e.g., focusing on a specific part, experimenting with phrasing, running through from start to finish, working on sections, isolating variables, making group choices), independently for collective practise, rehearsal and performance.

39B62484D8B44420AD4A49B990C2AB32.description: Demonstrate fluency and growth in vocal techniques and musicality when singing advanced vocal ensemble repertoire.

ECC0C05AA4534B8F901718A763ADB40F.description: Maintain accurate pitch when singing harmony.

3D26E03D9EF94A1195909B065E188980.description: Demonstrate interpretation abilities through versatility of voice (e.g., inflection, tone, emulating instrumental sounds).

E1DBB032652A453096178E4131D32A9F.description: Demonstrate personal and interpersonal skills necessary for ensemble music making including: etiquette, rehearsal protocols and leadership

6CB5B53B0E384D90BD5230E6D69C1885.description: Adjust vocal techniques as appropriate within the context of the ensemble, such as: adjusting dynamics, blending vowels, placing consonants, adjusting vibrato and maintaining own part.

92CB76B6B2864F91BBCBD10F6C8604D9.description: Apply decision-making abilities, skills and practices for improving ensemble singing.

1094E1E4B98E42E8817D1F323B9DA40D.description: Identify factors and apply techniques for maintaining vocal health.

7D51309DF47C4C4E99A49E263C0D598B.description: Demonstrate choral blend through vowel unity and modifying intonation with diverse repertoire.

705719F8B8DC40968372455F12F4BC56.description: Demonstrate and articulate the importance of proper posture and body alignment for singing.

E3D1D5C05ED0429E94A41CC05AFE755B.description: Consistently demonstrate appropriate diction required of the language and repertoire demands.

2144A50111CF48848CCDB14D892B7C1B.description: Enact principles of vocal anatomy and terminology (e.g., how does one support breathing, the role of articulators and resonators in enunciation).

D1DEA9BF717E495589DD9EEF4DAAC6AD.description: Apply, with guidance, a well-supported characteristic tone quality as appropriate to the repertoire.

119AE88DED48467193C145530DC5AA74.description: Demonstrate effective transition in accessing different registrations and evenness of tone throughout the range (i.e., passaggio).

307B6281145941E0987EBF3162F8E347.description: Discuss the difference between performance range versus singable range (e.g., singable range might be A# or B but would not use that range in production).

8B8E4B49C20049F689C2F91F0F85348F.description: Practise healthy ways to expand own range.

FCC50B68D6E4407DA0E977D17DC78F24.description: Create own vocal warmup sequences for purposes related to the repertoire.

BA85D87F1CAF4026A13C3C5AF71F2289.description: Discern pitch variances and make appropriate adjustments.

F06B33A60C4640E18E2F4138CE50D18C.description: Collaborate with peers, with teacher guidance, to develop criteria for high quality singing considering cultural context.

7640229BFCC54854B8185A2210F7AAF3.description: Sing with breath support (e.g., practise appropriate breathing technique and recognize how it helps support sound production, vocal health and characteristic tone quality).

FF1AFA50D7EC44C597F3DFF302045FE3.description: Refine fundamentals and demonstrate advanced vocal technique.

80A9BFA340D44739934F8C9C76A139F0.description: Creative/Productive (CP) Goal: Students will inquire, create and communicate through dance, drama, music and visual art.
